meanings.definition: An attack or trap in which individuals lie in wait to surprise their enemy.
meanings.sent1: The soldiers set up an ambush in the forest to catch the enemy off guard.
meanings.sent2: The rebels planned an ambush on the convoy to steal supplies.
meanings.sent3: During the game of hide-and-seek, the kids set up an ambush to surprise their friend.
meanings.sent4: The clever fox set up an ambush to catch the unsuspecting rabbit.
meanings.sent5: The ambush in the movie was so intense, it kept me on the edge of my seat.

meanings.definition: To attack or trap someone by lying in wait.
meanings.sent1: The hunters decided to ambush the deer at the watering hole.
meanings.sent2: The bandits planned to ambush the travelers on the lonely road.
meanings.sent3: The siblings plotted to ambush their parents with water balloons as they came home.
meanings.sent4: The spy knew he had to ambush the enemy agent before he escaped.
meanings.sent5: The ninja silently moved to ambush the guards and infiltrate the fortress.
